title: Manchester United hold emotional commemoration in Belgrade to honour those who died in Munich air disaster 61 years ago
text:
Manchester United held an emotional commemoration ceremony in Belgrade on Thursday morning in honour of those who tragically lost their lives in the Munich air disaster 61 years ago.

United officials and former players gathered at the Partizan Stadium, which was the site of the last game Sir Matt Busby’s famous “Babes” played before their fateful journey back to Manchester via Munich.

United had drawn 3-3 with Red Star Belgrade in the second leg of their European Cup quarter final to reach the last four and appeared on the brink of greatness only for their plane to crash on a slush covered runway as it attempted to take off at Munich-Riem airport following a refuelling stop. Twenty-three people, including eight players, lost their lives in the tragedy.

Representatives from United, including executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward and former captain Bryan Robson, and the Manchester Munich Memorial Foundation, gathered in the centre circle to listen to a short address commemorating those who lost their lives. Sian Macleod, UK Ambassador to Serbia, was also in attendance.

Robson and Mickey Thomas, another former United player and club ambassador, then laid down a wreath, before a minute’s silence was held to remember the victims ahead of the club’s Europa League meeting with Partizan Belgrade at the stadium on Thursday night.
description: Manchester United held an emotional commemoration ceremony in Belgrade on Thursday morning in honour of those who tragically lost their lives in the Munich air disaster 61 years ago.
